ressaisir

Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

French

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • resaisir

Etymology

[edit]

From re- +‎ saisir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ʁə.sɛ.ziʁ/ ~ /ʁə.se.ziʁ/
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

ressaisir

  1. (transitive) to regain or recover (that which was lost)
    Synonym: récupérer
  2. (pronominal, reflexive) to compose oneself, pull oneself together, to get back on one's feet, to pick oneself up off the floor, to get a grip on oneself
    Synonym: se reprendre en main

Conjugation

[edit]

This is a regular verb of the second conjugation, like finir, choisir, and most other verbs with infinitives ending in -ir. One salient feature of this conjugation is the repeated appearance of the infix -iss-.

Conjugation of ressaisir (see also Appendix:French verbs)
infinitive simple ressaisir
compound avoir + past participle
present participle or gerund1 simple ressaisissant
/ʁə.sɛ.zi.sɑ̃/ or /ʁə.se.zi.sɑ̃/
compound ayant + past participle
past participle ressaisi
/ʁə.sɛ.zi/ or /ʁə.se.zi/

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

This is a regular verb of the second conjugation, like finir, choisir, and most other verbs with infinitives ending in -ir. One salient feature of this conjugation is the repeated appearance of the infix -iss-.
